column1: Smoque BBQ////I had the brisket and was of the opinion that it was good
column2: not great.  It hardly rates up against the Texas BBQ that apparently attempts to emulate
column4: Country Tavern in Kilgore or Salt Lick outside of Austin.  All three beat the socks off this place.  That being said
column5: Smoque is serviceably good.  I'd go back
column6: but it's not going to envoke the mouthwatering daydreams that any of the above mentioned places might.
